subject: p13979643
History: Small bowel obstruction, fever and abdominal pain, NG tube placement, question new pneumonia.
Findings: The NG tube tip is in the stomach, which still has a large amount of air within it. There is volume loss at both bases and a probable small left effusion. There is pulmonary vascular re-distribution and mild cardiomegaly. Left subclavian line tip is in the SVC.
